Module org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi
Package org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi

Class AFUNIXNaming

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.newsclub.net.unix.rmi.AFUNIXNaming
  • public final class AFUNIXNaming
extends java.lang.Object
    The AFUNIXSocket-compatible equivalent of Naming. Use this class for accessing RMI registries that are reachable by AFUNIXSockets.
    Author:
    Christian Kohlschütter

      • newPrivateInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming newPrivateInstance()
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a new private instance that resides in a custom location, to avoid any collisions with existing instances.
        Returns:
        The private AFUNIXNaming instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operation fails.

      • getInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance()
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the default instance of AFUNIXNaming. Sockets are stored in java.io.tmpdir.
        Returns:
        The default instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operation fails.

      • getInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance​(java.io.File socketDir)
                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns a AFUNIXNaming instance which support several socket files that can be stored under the same, given directory.
        Parameters:
        socketDir - The directory to store sockets in.
        Returns:
        The instance.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the operation fails.

      • getInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance​(java.io.File socketDir,
                                       int registryPort)
                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns a AFUNIXNaming instance which support several socket files that can be stored under the same, given directory. A custom "registry port" can be specified. Typically, AF-UNIX specific ports should be above 100000.
        Parameters:
        socketDir - The directory to store sockets in.
        registryPort - The registry port. Should be above 100000.
        Returns:
        The instance.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the operation fails.

      • getInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getInstance​(java.io.File socketDir,
                                       int registryPort,
                                       java.lang.String socketPrefix,
                                       java.lang.String socketSuffix)
                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getSingleFileInstance

        public static AFUNIXNaming getSingleFileInstance​(java.io.File socketFile)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an AFUNIXNaming instance which only supports one file. (Probably only useful when you want/can access the exported UnicastRemoteObject directly)
        Parameters:
        socketFile - The socket file.
        Returns:
        The instance.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the operation fails.

      • getRegistry

        public AFUNIXRegistry getRegistry()
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns a reference to the existing RMI registry. If there's no registry running at this port, an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        The registry.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there was a problem.

      • getRegistry

        public AFUNIXRegistry getRegistry​(boolean create)
                           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns a reference to the RMI registry, or null. If there's no registry running at this port, and create is set to true, a new one is created; when create is set to false, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        create - true if a new register may be created if necessary.
        Returns:
        The registry, or null
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there was a problem.

      • createRegistry

        public AFUNIXRegistry createRegistry()
                              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Creates a new RMI Registry. Use getRegistry() to try to reuse an existing registry.
        Returns:
        The registry
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the operation fails.
        See Also:
        getRegistry()

      • exportAndBind

        public void exportAndBind​(java.lang.String name,
                          java.rmi.Remote obj)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                          java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException
        Exports and binds the given Remote object to the given name, using the given AFUNIXNaming setup.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to use to bind the object in the registry.
        obj - The object to export and bind.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the operation fails.
        java.rmi.AlreadyBoundException - if there already was something bound at that name

      • exportAndRebind

        public void exportAndRebind​(java.lang.String name,
                            java.rmi.Remote obj)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Exports and re-binds the given Remote object to the given name, using the given AFUNIXNaming setup.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to use to bind the object in the registry.
        obj - The object to export and bind.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the operation fails.

      • unexportAndUnbind

        public void unexportAndUnbind​(java.lang.String name,
                              java.rmi.Remote obj)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Forcibly un-exports the given object, if it exists, and unbinds the object from the registry (otherwise returns without an error).
        Parameters:
        name - The name used to bind the object.
        obj - The object to un-export.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the operation fails.

      • exportObject

        public static java.rmi.Remote exportObject​(java.rmi.Remote obj,
                                           java.rmi.server.RMISocketFactory socketFactory)
                                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Exports the given Remote object, using the given socket factory and a randomly assigned port. NOTE: This helper function can also be used for regular RMI servers.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to export.
        socketFactory - The socket factory to use.
        Returns:
        The remote stub.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if the operation fails.

      • unexportObject

        public static void unexportObject​(java.rmi.Remote obj)
        Forcibly un-exports the given object, if it exists (otherwise returns without an error). This should be called upon closing a Closeable Remote object. NOTE: This helper function can also be used for regular RMI servers.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to un-export.
